ygData.subject: RE: [archive-crawler] Re: Visibility of CrawlScope Logger
ygData.msgSnippet: There is no reason why each class shouldn t have its own logger. In fact, there is every reason for each class to have their own logger, rather then sharing

------=_NextPart_000_0000_01C561CE.EC853FC0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

There is no reason why each class shouldn't have its own logger. In fact,
t=
here is every reason for each class to have their own logger, rather then
s=
haring one, since it makes it clearer where the output was originated. If
y=
ou take a look at the various modules you'll see that most - if not all -
o=
f them create their own loggers if they are needed at all.
 
Having said th=
at, I would like to point out that you actually CAN access the
exact same l=
ogger by invoking:
 
Logger.getLogger(CrawlScope.class.getName());
 
If you=
 read the description of the getLogger method it says "Find or create
a log=
ger for a named subsystem. If a logger has already been created with
the gi=
ven name it is returned. Otherwise a new logger is created."
 
I would howe=
ver STRONGLY suggest creating a logger specific for your class.
 
- Kris

-=
----Original Message-----

[mailto:arc=

ility of CrawlScope Logger


--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "stack=
@a..." <stack@a...> wrote:
> hc696_9 wrote:
> 
> > Can you please change th=
e visibility of Logger in Class
> > org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlScop=
e from:
> > "static final Logger logger =3D
> > Logger.getLogger(CrawlScope=
.class.getName());"
> > back to
> > "protected static final Logger logger =
=3D
> > Logger.getLogger(CrawlScope.class.getName());"
> >
> > otherwise it=
's not possible to access it from other packages. Sorry,
> > I'm not one of=
 your developers and can't update this change to your
> > CVS.
> >
> > Than=
ks, Adrian
> >
> What if I added an accessor instead?
> 
> Is there a reaso=
n why you do not want to add a logger to your subclass?
> 
> Yours,
> St.Ac=
k
> 

I was thinking of, that I always have to use the same instance of
Log=
ger, isn't it? That's the reason why I would like to access this
static var=
iable. If not, I can't find a reason why I shouldn't add a
logger to my sub=
class.
